description: Michael W. Raphael is currently a student at Northeastern University in Boston, MA. He studies dramaturgy, sociology of knowledge, sociology of law, semiotics, phenomenology and social theory. For over a decade, he has conducted ethnographic research in the inflatable amusements industry studying the phenomenon of temporality and social interaction. Simultaneously, as an avid chess player, he has won 3 State Chess Championships and other honors. He uses his deep understanding of chess to bring to light new perspectives in sociology, criminology, semiotics, phenomenology and dramaturgy.
